p: Kobuviruses are non-enveloped, icosahedral viruses of approximately 27â€“30 nm in diameter. Based on the genomic organization and sequence similarities, the genus Kobuvirus currently includes six officially recognized species: Aichivirus A (formerly Aichi virus), Aichivirus B (formerly Bovine kobuvirus), Aichivirus C (porcine kobuvirus), Aichivirus D (kagovirus 1), Aichivirus E (rabbit kobuvirus) and Aichivirus F (bat kobuvirus 1). Feline kobuvirus (FeKoV) is classified within the species Aichivirus A, along with the human AiV, canine kobuvirus (CaKoV), murine kobuvirus (MuKoV), Kathmandu sewage kobuvirus, and roller kobuvirus ( Figure 2) [ 78, 79].
